column2: also Romanized as Tonekābon; formerly known as Shahsavar (Persian: شَهسَوار)
column3: also Romanized as Shahsavār and Shahsawār) is a city and capital of Tonekabon County

column5: 087 families. The languages of Tonekabon are Mazandarani.

column1: Shahsavar is located on the coast of the southern Caspian Sea
The town of Shahsavar is nearby along the Caspian Sea
column2: and Tonekabon County has common borders with Qazvin Province to the south.

column1: In its northern regions it has a moderate and humid climate and in the southern portions cold weather prevails.
Cheshmeh Kileh River is located in this city.
The territory of Shahsavar was originally part of Gilan. Numerous evidences discovered in various parts of the region
column2: indicate that it was a flourishing city in past. The ancient Tonekabon came under the realm of the Royan territory
column3: also called Rostamdar. The Padusbanan held the power of this vicinity till the reign of Shah Abbas Safavid I. Thereafter until the year 1209 CE. which was the beginning of the reign of Aqa Mohammad Khan Qajar and the Qajar dynasty
column4: the city was known as Feiz.

column1: After downfall of the Qajar dynasty
column2: the city was renamed Shahsavar. After the 1979 Revolution the name was returned to its original historic one
column3: Tonekabon. Most present-day people of the city still use the "Shahsavar" name.
is grown in the city and bears its former name. The other products of Shahsavar are kiwi fruit

column1: Shahsavar has a semi tropical climate. The temperature is mild all the year.
The "Ghalegardan high lands" and "Dohezar Valley" are famous resort areas in the Alborz (Elburz) mountain range
column2: southwest of Shahsavar. There are also dense forests in Dohezar and the Sehezar Road areas of the Alborz.
